Expeditions

For us, birding is a form of meditation that provides relaxation and exercise. We post our field notes here along with pictures from our trips.

Playa Grande

Costa Rica Adventure part 3 of 3. On the Pacific coast in Playa Grande.

Rainforests

Costa Rica Adventure part 2 of 3. Rainforests of Monte Verde and Bijagua.

Palo Verde

Costa Rica Adventure part 1 of 3. Lowlands of Palo Verde National Park.

Winter is Coming

It's been a while since we posted but we've seen a lot of birds this Fall.

Where is Fall?

We faced the cold weather to go birding with friends near Calgary Alberta.

The West Coast

On a visit to BC we hit up areas between Duncan and Sooke for birds.

Cold Lake Warbs

Cold Lake is known to be one of the best warbler sites in Alberta.

Into the Foothills

Exploring the foothills near Calgary has been exciting and beautiful.

Burrowing Owls

The burrowing owl is the kingpin on the Bird Nerds' most wanted list.

Busy Birders

In the last weeks we hit Frank Lake, Vancouver BC, and did a species count.

They're Back!

We got a tip to look for birds in a city park and had a new first sighting.

Spring Elsewhere

We attempted to do some Spring birding but there is still snow everywhere.

Saddlebird

A favorite sign of Spring in Alberta is the appearance of mountain bluebirds.

Brooks Mega Trip

Woody Wednesday

Feathers and Fur

When birding we usually expect to see birds but on this trip we saw mammals.

Cabin Fever

The plan was to hit our three favorite birding places in one weekend.

Feel the Migration

Now that it's staying light out later we can hit up Inglewood after work.

Prowl for an Owl

After reported sightings of a barred owl in the Weaselhead we went looking for it.

Redpoll Revisit

We've had success at Weaselhead and it's quickly becoming our favorite birding place.

Redpoll Rollin

There was a bird we hadn't seen before at the Weaselhead when we last ventured out.

We went looking for Winter Eagles in Inglewood and were not disappointed.
